title: mari65
author: mari65
content: Mix TV Presents: Eminem (also known as Mix TV Presents The Eminem Game in the ESRB database) was a planned game to be developed by Conspiracy Entertainment based off the rapper, Eminem. Announced on May 14, 2003, the game was to feature six puzzles game wordsovlered.com for players to complete, as well as four music videos by Eminem (two of which were revealed: "My Name Is" and "The Real Slim Shady") and unspecified bonus material.The game was completed and submitted to the ESRB in two separate forms (the standard receiving a T rating for "Comic Mischief, Mild Lyrics, Suggestive Themes", and the 'uncut' receiving an M for "Strong Lyrics").On July 28, 2003, Conspiracy Entertainment filed a $5 million lawsuit against Eminem's representatives for pulling out of the deal, supposedly because they were looking for a bigger company to release the game.
